findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The smart contract incorporates a redundant require statement within the `_mint` function that verifies whether the `mintingFinishedPermanent` variable is set to `false`. However, this verification is redundant since the `_mint` function is only invoked within the constructor of the contract.

findings.title: RCC - Redundant Condition Check
findings.description: The contract checks whether the sender or the recipient is excluded from fees using an initial if statement. If neither the sender nor the recipient is excluded from fees, the code within the second if statement is executed. However, the condition in the second if statement redundantly checks for the opposite of the first if statement.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares the `mintedByAstroVerse` variable to `true`, but the variable is not used in a meaningful way by the contract.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that their value cannot be changed after it has been set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L08 - Tautology or Contradiction
findings.description: A tautology is a logical statement that is always true, regardless of the values of its variables. A contradiction is a logical statement that is always false, regardless of the values of its variables.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured with user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone.
